conclusion: To determine where the liquid will flow, analyze the path it takes after passing through the baffles.
Liquid flows out from points A, B, and C at the top of the image.
There are baffles of various colors (red, green, blue, brown, orange, purple) positioned diagonally in the image.
At the bottom of the image, there are two house-shaped containers labeled D (red) and E (green).
Flow from A moves down and to the right, passing through the blue baffle, then hits the brown baffle and is redirected downward.
Flow from B moves straight down, hits the intersection of the green and brown baffles, is redirected to the right, and flows down past the blue baffle.
Flow from C moves straight down, meets the green baffle, is redirected to the left, passes through the blue baffle, and continues downward.
All three streams (A, B, and C) converge and flow downward, passing through the openings in the green and red house-shaped containers.
The liquid is directed to flow into container D.
Final Answer: The liquid from A, B, and C will flow into container D.
